title: Ekko and Bard have copy pasted Dota ults
body:
People stopped harping about League copying Dota a little while after Darius came out.

That was 2012.

Perhaps Tencent's Money-to-Content-o-tron™s are broken?

League and Dota are different games.

Keep them that way.

replies.body:
To be fair game mechanics can't be copyrighted.

Not to mention DotA was just a mod, and Riot dev themselves worked on and maintained its existence for a while before they started League.

Nothing to do with legal/moral issues, moreso the integrity of what exactly League is.

If Tencent's way of adding new mechanics is just copying mechanics from another game, what exactly does that make League?

> [{quoted}](name=Malygos,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=ytKmgRQN,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-05-14T04:49:49.774+0000)
>
> Nothing to do with legal/moral issues, moreso the integrity of what exactly League is.
> 
> If Tencent's way of adding new mechanics is just copying mechanics from another game, what exactly does that make League?

Tencent has been having control over Riot for like 4 years already, so if anything it's not really their fault, at least not directly.

Game mechanics are acceptable to be copy pasted as long as the individual titles themselves involve enough innovations to differentiate from each other. That's precisely why we acknowledge say Elder Scrolls, Witcher and Souls to be completely different games even though 80% of each game is a completely clone to everyone else, because that's why we say they're in the same genre.

Harping on a few champs in LoL for having same skills as certain few in DotA would be like complaining why Skyrim has dragon bone weapons/armour while Dark Souls also has them or something along the lines, you get the idea.

It really depends on how much is ported from DotA to LoL, a few champ's skill overlap imo really isn't that much of a big deal since both games already have different mechanical emphasis and focus anyway.

Google Kirby Ferguson's video series "Everything is a remix" as it'll give you a broader perspective of what is defined as creativity and combine that with whatever knowledge you have of what motivates businesses. League is still League, and "copying" is part of what it does: it takes elements of pre-existing (and popular) creative works and turns them into something that, put together, is new and (hopefully) "better". Better referring to whatever it is Riot as a business values, eg. its popularity with players.

There's a huge difference between drawing inspiration and ctrl c ctrl v.

They didn't ctrl C ctrl V.
Ekko's ultimate damages those that are near him, by a ton I might add; with a heal. It can be used as an offensive damage source. The rewind point is also visually present to everyone, save blind people. The ultimate does not 'reset' ability cooldows to the same cooldown count a few seconds ago.

Weaver's ultimate does not deal any damage and is a utility ability, that resets items and abilities, health and mana to the same point a few seconds earlier. 

They have quite a few differences if you look at them closely.

I'm still of the mind League is less player friendly than Dota.

League doesn't have much intuitive design, it's all just METAGAMEMETAGAMEMETAGAME

That is to say, things that are theoretically awesome are very rarely that because metagaming always wins.
It's more like, the second chapter of the D.O.T.A. series. Like, D.O.T.A. 2. Only it's named League of Legends.

Its no different to 
Samsung/Apple
Playstation/Xbox
Windows/Mac 
they are essentially the same thing, just a bit different in certain aspects to appease afferent audiences, both of them copy each other.
these two ults might just fall into the section that is the same as dota, its no big deal. 
Usually there it is a class/power thing 
for example Apple/Mac/Playstation are the classy option whereas Samsung/Xbox/Windows are the power option 
i have never played dota so i dont know if it is the class or the power of the two but judging from dota's design style id say that league is the class option.  
so these two ults might be of the tactic to make dota players who want a bit more class to start playing league.

Hardcore DotA or Dota 2 players consider League to be of inferior difficulty. Some call League cancer. Most of their player base consist of elitist hardcore gamers. I don't think having Ekko's ult in this game will attract many Dota players.
thats what i mean, dota is the power of the two e.g. more difficult etc and league is the class, better design more well known in the real world of non gamers

I don't know about better design. 
I think that's subjective. Both great games but different in approach.
